10:51 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <GuillaumeF> Hello  
10:52 <GuillaumeF> I'm running a XE 5.0, and if I understood correctly, I can easily switch it to a farm, simply installing the Wiki Manager app, right?  
10:52 <GuillaumeF> I got "Dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-oldcore-5.0.3] is not compatible with core extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore-5.0]" when I try to do so in the extension manager  
10:54 <tmortagne> GuillaumeF: right, since 5.0 you are always in virtual mode already so all you need is some UI to help you create new wikis  
10:55 <tmortagne> that's because wiki manager 5.0.3 has dependency on oldcore 5.0.3 or more  
10:55 <tmortagne> you can use advanced search to install wiki manager 5.0  
10:55 <tmortagne> (advanced search is not really a search, it allows you to indicate the exact id and version of the extension you want)  
10:56 <GuillaumeF> great, seems to work  
10:56 <GuillaumeF> but it's a bit disturbing  
10:56 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <kstuart> has quit  
10:58 <tmortagne> GuillaumeF: yes, it's a bit expensive right now to select the version that will work with your current setup while searching (imagine applying the first step of the install on all the extensions on extensions.xwiki.org...)  
10:59 <GuillaumeF> I get it  
10:59 <GuillaumeF> thanks for the answer!  
11:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <msmeria> tmortagne: I'm doing migrations from 5.0.3 (I've created 3 subwikis) to 5.1-snap with the DW. After the first step of installing the UI if I click continue I'm taken directly to the homepage (http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome). I can't choose the upgrade mode in step 2  
11:05 <tmortagne> msmeria: hmm you should be able I think but maybe it keeps what you answer during 5.0.3 install  
11:05 <tmortagne> checking  
11:06 <msmeria> this happened for both 5.0.3 and 5.1m2  
11:06 <tmortagne> msmeria: you did not get it when install from scratch ?  
11:07 <msmeria> from scratch I never get it  
11:07 <tmortagne> so basically you never get it whatever you do ?  
11:07 <msmeria> yup  
11:07 <tmortagne> that's definitely a bug  
11:07 <msmeria> on previous versions I got it on a similar environment  
11:08 <msmeria> when upgrading a version with 3 subwikis  
11:08 <tmortagne> it works in 5.0.2 and is broken in 5.0.3  
11:08 <tmortagne> ?  
11:08 <msmeria> no. I meant when I upgraded from 5.0.1 to 5.0.2  
11:08 <msmeria> as an example  
11:09 <msmeria> I don't remember exactly  
11:09 <tmortagne> yes so you have it in 5.0.2  
11:09 <msmeria> I think so, yeah  
11:09 <tmortagne> anyway, could you create an issue with detailed step by step and I will fix it  
11:10 <msmeria> sure, it's just that it reproduces on the latest snap. I'm going to also try on m2  
11:10 <tmortagne> msmeria: anyway you said you don't get it in 5.0.3 so that's definitely a bug  
11:11 <tmortagne> you should always have it when you install a new instance with DW  
11:11 <tmortagne> what is weird is that I'm pretty sure I saw it last time I did a 5.0.2 -> 5.0.3 upgrade  
11:11 <msmeria> you mean when I clean install from the war ? not on upgrades ?  
11:12 <tmortagne> yes what I asked you as "install from scratch"  
11:12 <msmeria> then that's a old bug...  
11:13 <msmeria> an\*  
11:31 <tmortagne> msmeria: old how ? I'm absolutely sure you have seen the upgrade mode choice step in 5.0.x  
11:31 <tmortagne> s/you/to/  
11:31 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <msmeria> i was talking about installing from scratch  
11:31 <tmortagne> yes me too  
11:31 <msmeria> and not getting the second step  
11:32 <tmortagne> I think you mix the upgrade mode step with did not existed before 5.0 and what is now the 3rd step  
11:32 <tmortagne> s/with/which/  
11:33 <msmeria> isn't it the second step now ?  
11:33 <tmortagne> what is ?  
11:33 <msmeria> the 3rd is about extensions afaik  
11:33 <tmortagne> yes  
11:33 <msmeria> the upgrade mode step :D  
11:33 <tmortagne> that's what I'm telling  
11:33 <tmortagne> you  
11:33 <msmeria> you just said " the upgrade mode step with did not existed before 5.0 and what is now the 3rd step"  
11:34 <tmortagne> 5.0 is not old so I don't see how not getting that step can be an old bug  
11:34 <tmortagne> you said not getting it was an old bug  
11:35 <tmortagne> it was perfectly normal to not get any second step before 5.0 when installing from scratch  
11:35 <msmeria> maybe I exagerated a bit  
11:35 <tmortagne> and I'm 100% sure it was working in 5.0  
11:35 <tmortagne> and I'm also sure I saw it last time I did an upgrade from 5.0.2 to 5.0.3  
11:36 <msmeria> on upgrades I saw it too  
11:36 <msmeria> until now that is :)  
11:36 <tmortagne> if you don't get it when installing it would be nice to report it  
11:36 <tmortagne> and detail how you install  
11:37 <msmeria> I;m creating the issue now  
11:38 <msmeria> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9254  
11:38 <msmeria> bbl  
11:41 <vmassol> sburjan`: the right to "run a test" is for anyone logged in, right?  
11:41 <vmassol> (on test.xwiki.org)  
11:41 <vmassol> sburjan`: it would be nice if you could make it simple to add a new xwiki version for a user  
11:42 <vmassol> hmm actually this just means allowing registered users to click on Management. Is that true right now?  
11:42 <vmassol> (also it might be good on the "run test" popup to have a link to create a new version of xwiki, etc  
11:43 <vmassol> sburjan`: basically I think we need to make sure any users from the community can easily run a test  
11:43 <vmassol> then we can start advertising it in the community  
11:43 <vmassol> to get testing help  
11:43 <sburjan`> vmassol: I did as you told me: I used #if($hasEdit)  
11:43 <vmassol> hasEdit is great, it means logged in user  
11:44 <sburjan`> if anyone who has hasEdit right can add a new version  
11:44 <sburjan`> same for accessing the management page  
11:44 <vmassol> note: I'm upgrading jenkins  
11:45 <vmassol> sburjan`: ok that's good  
11:45 <sburjan`> so what's the issue ?  
11:45 <vmassol> to make it simple to use  
11:45 <vmassol> by anyone  
11:45 <vmassol> see above  
11:46 <vmassol> a typical flow is this one:  
11:46 <vmassol> I find a test, I execute it locally then I click on "run test"  
11:46 <vmassol> then I need to fill the xwiki version for ex and my version is not listed  
11:46 <vmassol> I stop  
11:46 <vmassol> #fail  
11:47 <sburjan`> well not fail, this is why we have the management page, because you need to add before these versions  
11:47 <vmassol> it should be an autocomplete field with all existing versions that can be auto completed +  
11:47 <vmassol> the ability to add a new version directly from there  
11:47 <sburjan`> yes, I understand your POV  
11:47 <sburjan`> but  
11:47 <vmassol> sburjan`: stopping thinking as  a geek :)  
11:47 <vmassol> put yourself in users shoes  
11:48 <vmassol> some standard users who just want to participate  
11:48 <sburjan`> a product is an object made from 2 properties, Name and Version. I can't automate that  
11:48 <vmassol> and hasn't read your app's code  
11:48 <vmassol> of course you can  
11:48 <sburjan`> they don't have to read the code. They see the management button if they hit your #fail scenario  
11:49 <vmassol> obviously not  
11:49 <vmassol> nobody is ever going to click on managmeent  
11:49 <sburjan`> then maybe some text explaining the steps a user musttake in order to do this  
11:49 <vmassol> by nobody I mean 90% of users  
11:49 <vmassol> no explanation is bad  
11:49 <vmassol> whenever you need to explain something you've lost already  
11:50 <vmassol> explanation is acknowledge you failed  
11:50 <vmassol> and you're trying to find a way around the failure  
11:50 <vmassol> now it's a good \*temporary\* solution till you fix the issue  
11:50 <vmassol> :)  
11:51 <sburjan`> thing is I don;t know technically how to do what you want  
11:51 <sburjan`> even if I am thinking as a geek :)  
11:51 <sburjan`> because I have to create a new object and populate 2 properties what what I get from a input text, which is ...  
11:53 <vmassol> in your run test popup, split "Product" and "Version" in  fields  
11:53 <vmassol> \*2 fields  
11:53 <vmassol> and if we want to only support 1 product  
11:53 <vmassol> (which IMO should be the case)  
11:54 <vmassol> then just default to the XWiki product  
11:55 <sburjan`> could you please create a issue and assign it to me on Contrib ?  
11:55 <vmassol> sburjan`: FYI I've done some advertsigin for your app ;)  
11:55 <sburjan`> so I don't forget about it  
11:55 <sburjan`> where ? ;)  
11:55 <vmassol>  https://twitter.com/vmassol/status/348012556021018624  
11:56 <sburjan`> ooo ... nice :)  
11:57 <sburjan`> pleasantly impressed :)  
11:57 <sburjan`> this mean I have to make it better :)  
11:57 <vmassol> exactly  
11:57 <vmassol> hence the discussion ;)  
11:57 <vmassol> sburjan`: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCONTRIB-216  
11:58 <vmassol> sburjan`: for me that's one of the beauty part of this app, the ability to collaborative with several people easily to test xwiki  
11:59 <vmassol> \*collaborate  
12:01 <sburjan`> indeed  
12:19 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <chalx1> has quit  
12:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi I downloaded the latest snapshot went to the admin and selected solr as default search engine  
12:33 <vmassol> I got the following in the console: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5830366  
12:34 <vmassol> I do have the solr search ui though  
12:34 <vmassol> I then tried modifiying the home page and then search for "better" and I don't get any result  
12:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: I did not touched admin, no idea why you get an error when saving the conf  
12:35 <vmassol> restarting again from the zi  
12:35 <vmassol> zip  
12:37 <tmortagne> searching in page content when there is no language seems to have an issue I don't understand yet, the same query that works well with luke does not find anything with solr on the exact same lucene index  
12:37 <vmassol> I didn't get the issue when I tried again  
12:38 <tmortagne> which issue  
12:38 <tmortagne> ?  
12:38 <vmassol> the stack trace  
12:38 <tmortagne> ok  
12:39 <vmassol> btw realized I had save the home page and not Main.Welcome  
12:39 <vmassol> I've now edited and saved Main.Welcome but I still don't get "better" (nor "wiki" ftm)  
12:39 <tmortagne> yes that's what I was talking about  
12:39 <vmassol> ok  
12:40 <tmortagne> when I look at the index it's stored exactly the same way that a new page but still solr can't find it  
13:32 <mflorea> has quit  
14:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <vmassol> sburjan`: fyi: https://twitter.com/SimonBrandhof/status/348047939794501632  
14:51 <vmassol> (simon is from sonar)  
14:52 <vmassol> (I'm sure he has the need for testing sonar itself ;))  
14:56 <\_BuBU> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <\_BuBU> Hi  
14:56 <\_BuBU> is there a way to have bigger attachment  
14:56 <\_BuBU> ?  
14:56 <\_BuBU> I've tried to follow https://network.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/DocXE42En/AttachLargeFiles  
14:57 <\_BuBU> but seems the Maximum Upload Size property no longer exists for xwiki 5.x  
15:01 <\_BuBU> Using initially postgresql as DB  
15:03 <sburjan`> vmassol: I never imagined someone will re-act to your tweet. I'll retweet your tweet :)  
15:05 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <vmassol> \_BuBU: it's still there  
15:07 <vmassol> (just verified)  
15:07 <\_BuBU> vmassol: are we forced to use file storage ?  
15:07 <vmassol> no  
15:07 <vmassol> your choice  
15:07 <vmassol> but for large files it's better to use FS storage IMO  
15:07 <\_BuBU> ok I can still use postgresql right ?  
15:08 <vmassol> sure  
15:08 <\_BuBU> but how to allow bigger attachment  
15:08 <vmassol> \_BuBU: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments  
15:08 <\_BuBU> things like 50Mb  
15:08 <vmassol> \_BuBU: where did you get that URL you pasted above?  
15:08 <vmassol> (this one: https://network.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/DocXE42En/AttachLargeFiles )  
15:08 <\_BuBU> xwiki big attachments in google  
15:09 <vmassol> ah ok  
15:09 <\_BuBU> sorry 2nd one  
15:09 <vmassol> wdym by 2nd?  
15:10 <vmassol> "xwiki big attachments" doesn't get me to https://network.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/DocXE42En/AttachLargeFiles  
15:10 <\_BuBU> 2nd in the research  
15:10 <vmassol> ah yes  
15:10 <vmassol> I see it now  
15:10 <vmassol> it's further down for me  
15:11 <vmassol> thanks  
15:11 <\_BuBU> thx to u for the hints :)  
15:11 <vmassol> the official doc for the xwiki.org project is actually http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments  
15:11 <vmassol> :)  
15:12 <vmassol> the other link is some doc from the XWiki SAS company (http://xwiki.com), not from the open source project  
15:12 <\_BuBU> ok  
15:13 <vmassol> not that it's bad :) but just so that you know the difference!  
15:13 <\_BuBU> yep  
15:13 <\_BuBU> thx

16:11 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: I've attached a text file to a page and I'm trying to search for its content using solr, is it supposed to work?  
16:16 <vmassol> (on a new doc)  
16:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: did not tried but it should work yes AFAIK  
16:16 <vmassol> (for which I can search and find content)  
16:16 <vmassol> it's not working here  
16:16 <tmortagne> the UI enbale only document by default  
16:16 <vmassol> ah  
16:16 <tmortagne> you can choose the type to search  
16:17 <Mariah> hello  
16:17 <Mariah> somebody can help?  
16:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: doesn't work  
16:17 <vmassol> is the file extension important?  
16:17 <vmassol> (or is the type guessed from the content)  
16:18 <vmassol> my file is named applicationradyevent.patch  
16:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: the type is guessed from the extension I think  
16:18 <vmassol> but it's a text file  
16:18 <tmortagne> I did not do much testing on attachments yet  
16:18 <vmassol> fyi it works on lucene search  
16:18 <vmassol> but not in the solr search  
16:19 <vmassol> should I report it?  
16:19 <tmortagne> probably  
16:21 <Mariah> where can i find the minimum requirements for wiki´s installation?  
16:21 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9256  
16:21 <vmassol> Mariah: see here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites  
16:22 <Mariah> <vmassol> thnx a lot ! :D
